body: Starting a full set to see if the memory exception is handled and executor suite doesn't hang anymore.
Merging this  now. Rework of the original fix needs to be discussed. Hence JIRA-2046 is now reopened.
Please don't merge until hive tests have passed. Going to run the extra tests a few times to ensure the EAGAIN error is really handled.

Thanks for merging!

Thanks,

Amanda Moran

We also capture query statistics in the repository table. This include detailed statistics for each query that has run longer than a minute and also aggregate metrics for short running queries based on statement type. For example total selects, total inserts etc. We need to check the related to make sure this WITH statement is mapped accordingly to a SELECT if used with a SELECT statement.
@venkat1m yes, that is a very good point too. I will update the JIRA to include these requirements.
Not ready for merge. Still trying a few changes relevant only to Jenkins test environment.

Wow, this is a huge change. I didn't look at all the details, just at the big picture, and that looks good to me. Let me just ask a few questions, sorry, I should probably have answered those by myself by looking at the code:

We have these type classes, numerics, strings, datetime, interval. Where does boolean fit in here, is it treated as an exact numeric in internal methods? If so, some code has subclasses of numbers with binary and decimal precision, would this be another case that allows only two values? I'm partially thinking of UDFs, and how we should treat boolean values there.

As far as i can tell, this follows the ANSI definition of a boolean data type, is this true or are there differences?

Is this just experimental for now or should we add this type to the SQL Reference Manual?

Thanks, there are only a few people who can pull off a big change like this :-)

@traflm, I think Steve wanted the test to check whether the additional tables are there or not. If we test store_orc, existing setups won't create the new tables. Will that be a problem? What should people with an existing install_local_hadoop setup do?
So, where are we on this change? Is this ready to merge? @selvaganesang, do you have further issues?
I merged this in using a "--squash", but the automation didn't pick it up. Hence the separate "This closes #572" merge. The SHA for the squash commit was 2f9af4d.
Yes, I can certainly make these changes.  I have some other rework to do due to test failures. I will close this and re-open when changes are complete.
I think this is a good approach, but I have concerns over the safety of relying on errno to be unchanged across layers of Trafodion code.
Where is HBASE_DISTRO set? If this variable needs to be used and set we need to set it in the installer.

Your extra test failed because of a hang issue that has now been fixed. You can try them again and ensure hive tests run. They may not pass completely but if the result matches that of the master daily results, it shoudl be fine. I will trigger the tests again now.

@traflm . the short circuit check should ideally check the last item created  as you have pointed out. But if that is so, you have to alert the dev list to rerun the whole install_local_hadoop to get the new tpcds tables. Or better yet enhance the check to check for all the tables to be present.

Looks good. All my comments are minor, except the one in str.cpp which I suspect is a genuine bug. 

A general question: It looks like the only operations allowed on BOOLEAN columns are =, !=, and !. Are there plans to add support for AND and OR? Could I AND a BOOLEAN column with the result of a predicate?

hi Amanda, i suggest HBASE_DISTRO set in .bash_profile, and this is only used for developers.  It doesn't need to set in the installer, because while installation , the installer will get the hbase version by user input 1: Cloudera, 2: Hortonworks, 3: Other.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/906/
@mashengchen That's true, but the installer is not setting HBASE_DISTRO. It sets "HADOOP_TYPE". The installer can set this variable if you need, but it isn't right now.
@amandamoran ooh, yes ,you are right , it might determine by HADOOP_TYPE&HBASE VERSION, i am now not sure where it put this , do you have some suggestions?
@sandhyasun I see, I think I can enhance it to check all tables.

I think Steve's proposal is the simplest and best I prefer. I will append all CREATE statement after the previous last table, and keep the checking logic as the last one. Anyone who add new tables, if follow the same rule: append the DDL , and update the checking table. It is simple and seems solve concerns that one already run install_local_hadoop.

Response to Hans/Dave's comment regarding boolean datatype.

Boolean datatype is not a numeric datatype.
It cannot be used to compare or in arith opers with other numbers.
It is an additional datatype class to NUMERIC, CHARACTER, DATETIME, INTERVAL, BLOB.
Internally it is stored as a one byte value with 0 for false and 1 for true.

There is still some support for boolean needed in drivers and SPJ/UDF. 
Once that is done, we can document it in manuals. 

We could also enhance it later so relational and boolean datatype operations can be mixed.
Ex:  update t set a = (b > 10)  
   or use boolean datatype in a predicate of the form:  where a AND (b >  10);
(one can still use it as:  where (a = true) AND (b > 10) );
+1. Looks good. I did not imagine this could be done in the parser alone.
@mashengchen Where HADOOP_TYPE (traf_config_setup) is set I would add HBASE_DISTRO there, or change HBASE_DISTRO to just use HADOOP_TYPE.

+1. 
Agree with Dave that we should check errno as soon as possible after the call that could potentially raise it. errno seems to be checked in about 30 files in our source (under sql), so we may already be open to the issue that Dave has raised, though most of them could be checking sooner rather than later.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/ExtraTest-PR-master/32/
Is this ready to merge now?
